key_mistakes.reason: This move allowed White to strengthen their center uncontested, as Black voluntarily exchanged a central pawn without sufficient compensation.
This move blocked Black's queen, reducing coordination and development of pieces.
White pushed a pawn that did not create any real threats and exposed the pawn to Black's pieces.
This move opened up the c-file for Black's rook, increasing Black's control over the center.
This blunder weakened White's pawn structure and created unnecessary weaknesses.

recommendations: Focus on maintaining control of the center early in the game to restrict opponent's pieces.
Be cautious about pawn moves that create structural weaknesses or expose pawns to attack.
Prioritize the development and coordination of pieces to ensure they support each other effectively.
